Specs vs Hedgers Divergence: Reversal Risk

Specs vs hedgers divergence: macro reversal risk indicator.

As of 2025-10-07

Gemini Summary

State of the Market Summary:

  • The market is currently in a "Normal" divergence risk regime as of 2025-10-07.
  • The Macro_Divergence_Risk_z is -0.4298, reflecting reduced tension between speculators and hedgers.
  • The divergence share decreased from 0.2222 in early July to 0.1603 in October, indicating fewer markets show strong opposition.

Technical Summary:

  • The current Macro_Divergence_Risk_z of -0.4298 sits at the lower bound of the "Normal" regime.
  • This z-score indicates near historically low disagreement between speculative and commercial hedger positioning.
  • It suggests a decreased risk of broad-market position unwinds, a shift from early July's moderate risk (z-score 0.8498).

References:

  • Specs_vs_Hedgers_Divergence_Reversal_Risk.csv (latest: 2025-10-07 00:00:00)
  • Macro_Divergence_Risk_z and Macro_Divergence_Risk_Regime most influenced the conclusions.
  • Public datasets: Sector-level Commitment of Traders (CoT) data.
  • Open Interest data to assess market liquidity and crowding dynamics.
